item.title: Contact
item.dc:creator: Brian Gardner
item.content:encoded: [gravityform id=1 name=ContactForm title=false description=false] * This contact form was developed with a third party plugin called Gravity Forms and is not included in the Genesis Framework. It is for display only here on the demo site – though we highly recommend using it.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Hi Brian, i like of minimalist theme for wordpress. I tried download on the your website but is with broken link "Not found, error 404". Can you help me? You can send a link for download?
Tks a lot! Paulo Matos

Hi Brian, i like of minimalist theme for wordpress. I tried download on the your website but is with broken link "Not found, error 404". Can you help me? You can send a link for download?
Tks a lot! Paulo Matos

Hello,
I just installed this fantastic theme, but I'm new at this and I'm having trouble with menus. Is it possible to create a drop down menu with this theme, or does that require extra code? For example, I'd like the "Category" link to be a drop down menu that shows all the blog post categories.
Thank you!

Hello,
I just installed this fantastic theme, but I'm new at this and I'm having trouble with menus. Is it possible to create a drop down menu with this theme, or does that require extra code? For example, I'd like the "Category" link to be a drop down menu that shows all the blog post categories.
Thank you!
I am considering this wonderful theme template for my blog. Could you touch base so I can ask some questions? This is the Minimalist theme. I have the Genesis framework working with my blog.
I am considering this wonderful theme template for my blog. Could you touch base so I can ask some questions? This is the Minimalist theme. I have the Genesis framework working with my blog.

I hope this gets you well. Im writing in regard to your minimalist theme. I really love that theme as i really am looking for a clean, clutter free theme and was hoping to use it on a new blog i want to set up but i have a few issues. 1. is it possible that i could divide it to show two columns with a few distance (i think its padding) and show atleast three categories on the homepage? and the posts to show with snippets of text just like how the posts show on theminimalists.com? and the readers to open the post and read it on another page unlike what i see on the theme where all the post is on the same page? 2. Is it possible to add social icons on the homepage as well as on the post page (if it can be created)?
Thank you so much for your time,

item.title: Contact Page
item.dc:creator: Brian Gardner
item.content:encoded: Please fill out the form below and I will reply within 24 hours. [ninja_forms_display_form id=1] * This contact form was built with an open source plugin called Ninja Forms which is free to use and comes highly recommend by me.

item.title: Typography
item.dc:creator: Brian Gardner
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to the formatting page for the Minimalist Pro theme. We're glad you are interested in using this and want to show you how elements look. Want to see what a blockquote looks like?
This is an example of a WordPress post, you could edit this to put information about your site so readers know where you are coming from. You can create as many posts as you like in order to share with your readers what is on your mind.
Perhaps you'd like to see what an unordered list looks like?
  • Unordered list item #1
  • Unordered list item #2
  • Unordered list item #3
Or you'd prefer to see what an ordered list looks like?
  1. Ordered list item #1
  2. Ordered list item #2
  3. Ordered list item #3
Care to see what the headings look like?

Headline 1

Headline 2

Headline 3

Headline 4

Headline 5
Headline 6
How about the styling for threaded comments? Starting with Version 2.7, WordPress has support for threaded comments. This is where you reply to a comment that was previously made, and makes reading comments easier. Take a look at the comments of this post and you will see.
